heading: cox interactive invests in mp3
subheading: the media conglomerate pays us$45 million for a 10 percent stake in mp3.com, on the eve of the music download site's ipo.
author: reuters
text: the internet unit of media company cox enterprises said wednesday it was investing us$45 million in mp3.com, giving a boost to the online music start-up's plans to be a major player in the future of digital music. cox interactive media also said it was forming a joint venture with san diego, california-based mp3.com, which features tens of thousands of songs that can be downloaded to pcs.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
